metadata.name: Configure Agent Terminal Command Allow/Deny Lists
metadata.description: Configure GitHub Copilot Agent Mode to automatically run trusted terminal commands without requiring manual approval for each execution
metadata.context: VS Code Settings for Terminal Automation
prerequisites: VS Code with GitHub Copilot installed
Understanding of which commands are safe to auto-approve

outputs: Allow list configured with trusted commands
Deny list configured with dangerous commands

steps.description: Open Settings via File > Preferences > Settings or Ctrl+,
Navigate to Extensions > GitHub Copilot > Experimental (or use search bar: 'agent terminal')

steps.output: Allow list setting visible with 'Add Item' button

steps.description: Click 'Add Item' and enter trusted commands one at a time (e.g., 'dotnet build', 'npm install', 'npm test', 'pytest')
steps.output: Allow list populated with trusted commands

steps.description: Locate 'Agent: Terminal: Deny List' setting and add dangerous commands to block
steps.output: Deny list configured with blocked commands

steps.description: Open Copilot Agent Mode and request it to run an allowed command (e.g., 'build the project'). Verify it executes automatically without prompt.
steps.output: Allowed command executes automatically in terminal
steps.success_criteria: Agent runs command without asking for permission

quality_checklist: Allow list contains frequently used, safe commands
Deny list contains potentially destructive commands
Test command executes automatically without approval prompt
Settings saved and persistent across VS Code restarts
Only non-destructive commands added to allow list

safety_guidelines.allow_list_rules: Only add commands that are: (1) Non-destructive, (2) Frequently used, (3) Safe to run in any project state
safety_guidelines.deny_list_rules: Block commands that: (1) Delete files/directories, (2) Modify git history, (3) Require elevated permissions, (4) Format disks
safety_guidelines.review_frequency: Review lists quarterly or when adopting new tools/frameworks

related_entities.workflow: WF-DEV-006 (Automate Terminal Commands in Agent Mode)
